meanings.definition: A substance that causes the formation of an eschar (noun)
meanings.sent1: The doctor applied the escharotic to the wound to help it heal.
meanings.sent2: The escharotic medication helped in the formation of a scab on the injury.
meanings.sent3: The escharotic ointment worked like magic, turning the cut into a protective scab.
meanings.sent4: Her care was an escharotic touch, transforming the wound into a shield against infection.
meanings.sent5: The escharotic treatment created a tough barrier over the wound, aiding in recovery.

meanings.definition: Causing the formation of an eschar (adjective)
meanings.sent1: The escharotic substance led to the development of a scab on the wound.
meanings.sent2: The burn was treated with an escharotic solution to promote healing.
meanings.sent3: His escharotic actions turned the situation into a protective layer of defense.
meanings.sent4: The harsh weather had an escharotic effect on the exposed skin, forming a protective layer.
meanings.sent5: The escharotic treatment created a shield-like covering over the injury, aiding in recovery.
